name: Chargify
description: Add a Chargify Instance to connect your existing Chargify Enterprise account to the Payments Hub, allowing you to manage your customers, products, etc. across multiple Payments Elements. You will need your Chargify Enterprise account information to add an instance.

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", âidFieldâ: âuser.idâ, âdatesConfigurationâ: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", âcreatedDateFieldâ: âuser.created_atâ, âcreatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. Endpoint only supports a single filter. Only `reference` is explicitly supported. If other fields are used in the expression the field name will be ignored and the value will be passed to the provider. The provider will return all results with fields matching the provided search term.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sort by created date. Valid values are asc & desc. Defaults to asc.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

address.description: The customer's shipping street address (i.e. '123 Main St.')

address_2.description: Second line of the customer's shipping address i.e. 'Apt. 100'

cc_emails.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of emails that should be cc'd on all customer communications.

country.description: The customer shipping address country, perferably in ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 format (i.e. 'US')

created_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was created in Chargify.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

id.description: The customer ID in Chargify.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

portal_customer_created_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal entry was created at for the customer.

portal_invite_last_accepted_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last accepted.

portal_invite_last_sent_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last sent at.

reference.description: The unique identifier used within your own application for this customer.

tax_exempt.description: (Optional) The tax exempt status for the customer. Acceptable values are true or 1 for true and false or 0 for false.

updated_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was last edited.

verified.description: Is the customer verified to use ACH as a payment method. Available only on Authorize.Net gateway.

zip.description: The customer's shipping address zip code (i.e. '12345')

customersPostResponse.description: You can create a new Customer at any time, or you may create a Customer at the same time you create a Subscription.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or where clause without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. The queryable fields is subcription_id. For example, To get a list of invoices for a specific subscription ID, your request would be formatted as follows:: subscription_id='12345'

resources.description: List all the fields for an object

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

product_familyGetById.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

resources.description: Search for products for a product family

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size. Defaults to 200 if not provided. Maximum of 2000

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number. Defaults to 1 if not provided

product_family.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

id.description: The id of the signup page

return_params.description: The params to be appended to the return_url

return_url.description: The url to which a customer will be returned after a successful signup

url.description: The url where the signup page can be viewed

productObject.description: Use the products endpoint to manage your products inventory within your Chargify Site

archived_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was archived

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was created

expiration_interval.description: A numerical interval for the length a subscription to this product will run before it expires

expiration_interval_unit.description: A string representing the trial interval unit for this product, either month or day

initial_charge_in_cents.description: The up front charge you have specified

interval.description: The numerical interval. i.e. an interval of '30' coupled with an interval_unit of day would mean this product would renew every 30 days

interval_unit.description: A string representing the interval unit for this product, either month or day

price_in_cents.description: The product price, in integer cents

product_family.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

return_params.description: The parameters to be appended to both update_return_url and, (if auto_create_signup_page is true,) return_url for the auto-created signup page

return_url.description: If auto_create_signup_page is true, this will set the url to which a customer will be returned after a successful signup for the auto-created signup page

tax_code.description: A string representing the tax code related to the product type. This is especially important when using the Avalara service to tax based on locale

trial_interval.description: A numerical interval for the length of the trial period of a subscription to this product.

trial_interval_unit.description: A string representing the trial interval unit for this product, either month or day

trial_price_in_cents.description: The price of the trial period for a subscription to this product, in integer cents

trial_type.description: The type of trial for this product, either no_obligation or payment_expected

update_return_params.description: The parameters will append to the url after a successful account update

update_return_url.description: The url to which a customer will be returned after a successful account update

updated_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was last updated

productsPATCHResponse.description: Use the products endpoint to manage your products inventory within your Chargify Site

archived_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was archived

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was created

expiration_interval.description: A numerical interval for the length a subscription to this product will run before it expires

expiration_interval_unit.description: A string representing the trial interval unit for this product, either month or day

initial_charge_in_cents.description: The up front charge you have specified

interval.description: The numerical interval. i.e. an interval of '30' coupled with an interval_unit of day would mean this product would renew every 30 days

interval_unit.description: A string representing the interval unit for this product, either month or day

price_in_cents.description: The product price, in integer cents

product_family.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

return_params.description: The parameters to be appended to both update_return_url and, (if auto_create_signup_page is true,) return_url for the auto-created signup page

return_url.description: If auto_create_signup_page is true, this will set the url to which a customer will be returned after a successful signup for the auto-created signup page

tax_code.description: A string representing the tax code related to the product type. This is especially important when using the Avalara service to tax based on locale

trial_interval.description: A numerical interval for the length of the trial period of a subscription to this product.

trial_interval_unit.description: A string representing the trial interval unit for this product, either month or day

trial_price_in_cents.description: The price of the trial period for a subscription to this product, in integer cents

trial_type.description: The type of trial for this product, either no_obligation or payment_expected

update_return_params.description: The parameters will append to the url after a successful account update

update_return_url.description: The url to which a customer will be returned after a successful account update

updated_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this product was last updated

id.description: The id of the signup page

return_params.description: The params to be appended to the return_url

return_url.description: The url to which a customer will be returned after a successful signup

url.description: The url where the signup page can be viewed

activated_at.description: Timestamp for when the subscription began (i.e. when it came out of trial, or when it began in the case of no trial)

balance_in_cents.description: Gives the current outstanding subscription balance in the number of cents.

cancel_at_end_of_period.description: Whether or not the subscription will (or has) canceled at the end of the period.

canceled_at.description: The timestamp of the most recent cancellation

cancellation_message.description: Seller-provided reason for, or note about, the cancellation

cancellation_method.description: The process used to cancel the subscription, if the subscription has been canceled. if the subscription's state is nil, the subscription is not canceled.

coupon_code.description: The coupon code applied to the subscription.

coupon_use_count.description: Number of times the applied coupon has been used

coupon_uses_allowed.description: Number of times the applied coupon can be used

created_at.description: The creation date for this subscription

current_period_ends_at.description: Timestamp relating to the end of the current (recurring) period (i.e.,when the next regularly scheduled attempted charge will occur)

current_period_started_at.description: Timestamp relating to the start of the current (recurring) period

delayed_cancel_at.description: Timestamp for when the subscription is currently set to cancel.

expires_at.description: Timestamp giving the expiration date of this subscription (if any)

id.description: The subscription unique id within Chargify

next_assessment_at.description: Timestamp that indicates when capture of payment will be tried or,retried. This value will usually track the current_period_ends_at, but,will diverge if a renewal payment fails and must be retried. In that,case, the current_period_ends_at will advance to the end of the next,period

next_billing_at.x-conditionally-required-description: The next_billing_at cannot be used when also specifying calendar_billing

next_product_id.description: Next product ID if delayed product change has been scheduled

payment_collection_method.description: The type of payment collection to be used in the subscription. May be automatic, or invoice

previous_state.description: Only valid for webhook payloads The previous state for webhooks that have indicated a change in state. For normal API calls, this will always be the same as the state (current state)

product_price_in_cents.description: The recurring amount of the product (and version), currently subscribed. This may differ from the current price of the product, if you've changed the price of the product but haven't, moved this subscription to a newer version

product_version_number.description: The version of the product currently subscribed.,NOTE: we have not exposed versions (yet) elsewhere in the API, but if,you change the price of your product the versions will increment and existing subscriptions will remain on prior versions (by default, to support price grandfathering)

reason_code.description: Code that indicates why the subscription was cancelled.

referral_code.description: The referral code used during signup of the subscription

signup_payment_id.description: The ID of the transaction that generated the revenue

signup_revenue.description: The revenue, formatted as a string of decimal separated dollars and cents, from the subscription signup

snap_day.description: The day of the month that the subscription will charge according to calendar billing rules, if used.

state.description: The current state of the subscription.

total_revenue_in_cents.description: Gives the total revenue from the subscription in the number of cents.

trial_ended_at.description: Timestamp for when the trial period (if any) ended

trial_started_at.description: Timestamp for when the trial period (if any) began

updated_at.description: The date of last update for this subscription

customer.description: This method allows to retrieve the Customer properties by Chargify-generated Customer ID.

address.description: The customer's shipping street address (i.e. '123 Main St.')

address_2.description: Second line of the customer's shipping address i.e. 'Apt. 100'

cc_emails.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of emails that should be cc'd on all customer communications.

country.description: The customer shipping address country, perferably in ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 format (i.e. 'US')

created_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was created in Chargify.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

id.description: The customer ID in Chargify.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

portal_customer_created_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal entry was created at for the customer.

portal_invite_last_accepted_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last accepted.

portal_invite_last_sent_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last sent at.

reference.description: The unique identifier used within your own application for this customer.

tax_exempt.description: (Optional) The tax exempt status for the customer. Acceptable values are true or 1 for true and false or 0 for false.

updated_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was last edited.

verified.description: Is the customer verified to use ACH as a payment method. Available only on Authorize.Net gateway.

zip.description: The customer's shipping address zip code (i.e. '12345')

product_family.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

billing_address.description: Billing address of the card on file

billing_address_2.description: Secondary billing address of the card on file

billing_city.description: Billing city of the card on file

billing_country.description: Country of the card on file

billing_state.description: Billing state of the card on file

billing_zip.description: Billing zip of the card on file

current_vault.description: Current vault of the payment method

expiration_month.description: Expiration month of the card on file

expiration_year.description: Expiration year of the card on file

id.description: The ID of the payment profile

last_name.description: Last name on card or bank account

masked_card_number.description: Masked card number only exposing the last 4 digits of the card

vault_token.description: If you have an existing vault_token from your gateway, you may associate it with this new payment profile.

customer_id.description: The ID of an existing customer within Chargify
customer_id.x-conditionally-required-description: Required, unless a customer_reference or a set of customer_attributes is given

customer_reference.description: The reference value (provided by your app) of an existing customer within Chargify.
customer_reference.x-conditionally-required-description: Required, unless a customer_id or a set of customer_attributes is given.

id.description: The subscription unique id within Chargify

next_billing_at.x-conditionally-required-description: The next_billing_at cannot be used when also specifying calendar_billing

next_product_id.description: Next product ID if delayed product change has been scheduled

payment_collection_method.description: The type of payment collection to be used in the subscription. May be automatic, or invoice

previous_state.description: Only valid for webhook payloads The previous state for webhooks that have indicated a change in state. For normal API calls, this will always be the same as the state (current state)

product_handle.description: The API Handle of the product for which you are creating a subscription. Required, unless a product_id is given instead
product_handle.x-conditionally-required-description: Required, unless a product_id is given instead

product_id.description: The Product ID of the product for which you are creating a subscription
product_id.x-conditionally-required-description: Required, unless a product_handle is given instead

product_price_in_cents.description: The recurring amount of the product (and version), currently subscribed. This may differ from the current price of the product, if you've changed the price of the product but haven't, moved this subscription to a newer version

product_version_number.description: The version of the product currently subscribed.,NOTE: we have not exposed versions (yet) elsewhere in the API, but if,you change the price of your product the versions will increment and existing subscriptions will remain on prior versions (by default, to support price grandfathering)

reason_code.description: Code that indicates why the subscription was cancelled.

referral_code.description: The referral code used during signup of the subscription

signup_payment_id.description: The ID of the transaction that generated the revenue

signup_revenue.description: The revenue, formatted as a string of decimal separated dollars and cents, from the subscription signup

snap_day.description: The day of the month that the subscription will charge according to calendar billing rules, if used.

state.description: The current state of the subscription.

total_revenue_in_cents.description: Gives the total revenue from the subscription in the number of cents.

address.description: The customer's shipping street address (i.e. '123 Main St.')

address_2.description: Second line of the customer's shipping address i.e. 'Apt. 100'

cc_emails.description: A list of emails that should be cc'd on all customer communications.

country.description: The customer shipping address country, perferably in ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 format (i.e. 'US')

email.description: The email address of the customer. Required when creating a customer via attributes.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer. Required when creating a customer via attributes.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer. Required when creating a customer via attributes.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

reference.description: A customer 'reference', or unique identifier from your app, stored in Chargify

tax_exempt.description: (Optional) The tax exempt status for the customer. Acceptable values are true or 1 for true and false or 0 for false.

zip.description: The customer's shipping address zip code (i.e. '12345')

billing_address.description: The credit card or bank account billing street address (i.e. 123 Main St.). This value is merely passed through to the payment gateway

billing_address_2.description: Second line of the customer's billing address i.e. Apt. 100

billing_city.description: The credit card or bank account billing address city (i.e. 'Boston'). This value is merely passed through to the payment gateway

billing_state.description: he credit card or bank account billing address state (i.e. MA).

cvv.description: The 3- or 4-digit Card Verification Value. This value is merely passed through to the payment gateway

expiration_month.description: The 1- or 2-digit credit card expiration month, as an integer or string

expiration_year.description: The 4-digit credit card expiration year, as an integer or string, i.e. 2012

first_name.description: First name on card or bank account. If omitted, the first_name from customer attributes will be used.

full_number.description: The full credit card number (string representation, i.e. 5424000000000015)

last_name.description: Last name on card or bank account. If omitted, the last_name from customer attributes will be used.

product_family.description: Nested attributes pertaining to the product family to which this product belongs

coupon_code.description: The coupon code applied to the subscription.

coupon_use_count.description: Number of times the applied coupon has been used

coupon_uses_allowed.description: Number of times the applied coupon can be used

created_at.description: The creation date for this subscription

current_period_ends_at.description: Timestamp relating to the end of the current (recurring) period (i.e.,when the next regularly scheduled attempted charge will occur)

current_period_started_at.description: Timestamp relating to the start of the current (recurring) period

delayed_cancel_at.description: Timestamp for when the subscription is currently set to cancel.

expires_at.description: Timestamp giving the expiration date of this subscription (if any)

id.description: The subscription unique id within Chargify

next_assessment_at.description: Timestamp that indicates when capture of payment will be tried or,retried. This value will usually track the current_period_ends_at, but,will diverge if a renewal payment fails and must be retried. In that,case, the current_period_ends_at will advance to the end of the next,period

next_billing_at.x-conditionally-required-description: The next_billing_at cannot be used when also specifying calendar_billing

next_product_id.description: Next product ID if delayed product change has been scheduled

payment_collection_method.description: The type of payment collection to be used in the subscription. May be automatic, or invoice

previous_state.description: Only valid for webhook payloads The previous state for webhooks that have indicated a change in state. For normal API calls, this will always be the same as the state (current state)

product_price_in_cents.description: The recurring amount of the product (and version), currently subscribed. This may differ from the current price of the product, if you've changed the price of the product but haven't, moved this subscription to a newer version

product_version_number.description: The version of the product currently subscribed.,NOTE: we have not exposed versions (yet) elsewhere in the API, but if,you change the price of your product the versions will increment and existing subscriptions will remain on prior versions (by default, to support price grandfathering)

reason_code.description: Code that indicates why the subscription was cancelled.

referral_code.description: The referral code used during signup of the subscription

signup_payment_id.description: The ID of the transaction that generated the revenue

signup_revenue.description: The revenue, formatted as a string of decimal separated dollars and cents, from the subscription signup

snap_day.description: The day of the month that the subscription will charge according to calendar billing rules, if used.

state.description: The current state of the subscription.

total_revenue_in_cents.description: Gives the total revenue from the subscription in the number of cents.

trial_ended_at.description: Timestamp for when the trial period (if any) ended

trial_started_at.description: Timestamp for when the trial period (if any) began

updated_at.description: The date of last update for this subscription

customer.description: This method allows to retrieve the Customer properties by Chargify-generated Customer ID.

address.description: The customer's shipping street address (i.e. '123 Main St.')

address_2.description: Second line of the customer's shipping address i.e. 'Apt. 100'

cc_emails.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of emails that should be cc'd on all customer communications.

country.description: The customer shipping address country, perferably in ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 format (i.e. 'US')

created_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was created in Chargify.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

id.description: The customer ID in Chargify.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

portal_customer_created_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal entry was created at for the customer.

portal_invite_last_accepted_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last accepted.

portal_invite_last_sent_at.description: The timestamp of when the Billing Portal invite was last sent at.

reference.description: The unique identifier used within your own application for this customer.

tax_exempt.description: (Optional) The tax exempt status for the customer. Acceptable values are true or 1 for true and false or 0 for false.

updated_at.description: The timestamp in which the customer object was last edited.

verified.description: Is the customer verified to use ACH as a payment method. Available only on Authorize.Net gateway.

zip.description: The customer's shipping address zip code (i.e. '12345')

resources.description: Retrieve a transaction for a subscription

transaction.description: Given that you have a valid transaction ID, you can retrieve its full details.

amount_in_cents.description: The amount in cents of the Transaction.

component_id.description: ID of the component, only available in the charge.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the Transaction was created.

ending_balance_in_cents.description: The remaining balance on the subscription after the Transaction has been processed.

gateway_order_id.description: A gateway-specific identifier for the transaction, separate from the gateway_transaction_id.

gateway_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID from the remote gateway (i.e. Authorize.Net), if one exists.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Transaction.

memo.x-samplevalue: Abigail Example - $10 Basic Plan: Renewal payment

payment_id.description: The unique identifier for the payment being explicitly refunded (in whole or in part) by this transaction.

product_id.description: The unique identifier for the product associated`: with the Subscription.

starting_balance_in_cents.description: The initial balance on the subscription before the Transaction has been processed.

subscription_id.description: The unique identifier for the associated Subscription.

success.description: Whether or not the Transaction was successful.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

transactions.description: The Transactions API allows you to view a list of all transactions both for a site and for an individual subscription.

amount_in_cents.description: The amount in cents of the Transaction.

component_id.description: ID of the component, only available in the charge.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the Transaction was created.

ending_balance_in_cents.description: The remaining balance on the subscription after the Transaction has been processed.

gateway_order_id.description: A gateway-specific identifier for the transaction, separate from the gateway_transaction_id.

gateway_transaction_id.description: The transaction ID from the remote gateway (i.e. Authorize.Net), if one exists.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Transaction.

memo.x-samplevalue: Abigail Example - $10 Basic Plan: Renewal payment

payment_id.description: The unique identifier for the payment being explicitly refunded (in whole or in part) by this transaction.

product_id.description: The unique identifier for the product associated`: with the Subscription.

starting_balance_in_cents.description: The initial balance on the subscription before the Transaction has been processed.

subscription_id.description: The unique identifier for the associated Subscription.

success.description: Whether or not the Transaction was successful.
